subject: Ethics
title: The Right to Disconnect
description: Learn The Right to Disconnect in one minute.

hook.text: Your boss emails you at 11pm. You answer. Every night. You're not paid overtime. This is 'just culture.'

buildup.text: Smartphones erased the boundary between work and life. Many employees feel always on-call, never truly off.

discovery.text: France passed a Right to Disconnect law in 2017, letting employees ignore work emails after hours without penalty.

twist.text: Enforcement is weak. Companies follow the letter but not the spiritâ€”sending 'FYI' emails that clearly expect replies.

climax.text: Australia, Spain, and Portugal followed France. The US has no such law. After-hours emails remain the norm.

punchline.text: If you can't stop working, you don't have a job. It has you.

quiz.question: What does France's Right to Disconnect law allow employees to do?
options: Work from home permanently without employer approval
Ignore work communications after hours without penalty
Quit their job without giving any notice
